messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Sometimes bridges fall down and we do not know why. Engineers need to study the problem carefully. Then they can find the reason. Sometimes, they used bad materials to build the bridge. Or maybe there was a problem with an important part of the bridge. In other cases, the bridge could only hold some weight. It could not hold more weight than that.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Sometimes bridges fall down and we do not know why. Engineers study the problem carefully to find the reason. Sometimes, people build the bridge with bad materials. Or an important part of the bridge has a problem. In other cases, a bridge can only hold a certain amount of weight. It cannot hold more.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Sometimes bridges fall down and we do not know why. The people who build bridges study the problem carefully to find the reason. Sometimes, people build the bridge with bad things. Or an important part of the bridge has a problem. In other cases, a bridge can only hold some weight. It cannot hold more.

metadata.feedback_text: PASS. The text is a perfect example of A2 simplification. It maintains factual accuracy while using short, declarative sentences. The vocabulary is strictly within the A1/A2 range. The simplification of 'engineers' to 'the people who build bridges' and 'inferior-quality material' to 'bad things' is excellent for this level.
